fields.headline: Best of the net
fields.bodyText: How do you get a warm glow in January? Well, you could head for the Caribbean; or you could volunteer for a spot of public-spirited hard graft on a Northern Irish beach (cheap) or burn the midnight oil on a Turkish beach looking for turtles (rather more expensive). Restoring Elizabethan fencing at Charlecote Park, Warwickshire From £51 per week Enjoy the deer and the facilities of Stratford-on-Avon youth hostel on this National Trust working holiday. Many of the 140 opportunities involve woodland management, footpath repair, pond clearance and rhododendron clearance. Volcanic park surveying near Naples, Italy £1,130 This particular project involves the study of a dormant volcanic region threatened by urban sprawl. Accommodation is relatively luxurious. But if you want to help out in a Ghanaian hippo sanctuary, you'll sleep in mud huts and help to cook millet and yams. Archaelogical and women's health projects are also on offer; costs are usually at least £1,000, excluding travel. Excavating Castell Henllys in Pembrokeshire £155 per week The Council for British Archaeology posts a few "fieldwork opportunities" for beginners and those with some experience. A subscription to the Archaeology Abroad bulletin (£10) enables you to receive details of around 1,000 opportunities each year, most for professionals but some for volunteers. Caring for people with physical disabilities in Surrey, Southampton, Essex, Nottingham or Southport Free board, lodging and travel costs for a week Around 6,500 volunteers each year enable disabled people to have a holiday and their carers to take a week off. Anyone over 16 can help and, although some of the duties can be demanding, it's possible to volunteer for a special-interest week and share craft and sports skills. IT teaching in Ecuador schools "Low-cost" accommodation provided Tutors in Word and Excel who speak basic Spanish are needed for two-month stints. Idealist.org has many longer-term, skilled placements like this one, particularly in the US. Teaching English for eight months in the Loire Valley Limited salary and expenses Ideal for 19- to 25-year-olds with A-level French, an interest in teaching and eight months to spare, this government-approved scheme is small but well-run. For similar teaching opportunities in the rest of the world aimed at FE and university students, see Britishcouncil.org
